title: Persepolis
summary: Ceremonial capital of the Achaemenids with grand staircases and iconic bas-reliefs.
facts: Founded by Darius I around 518 BCE.

title: Pasargadae
summary: Early imperial capital featuring the Tomb of Cyrus the Great and proto-Persian garden layout.
facts: Influenced the Chahar Bagh garden typology.
Key milestone of early imperial urbanism.

title: Naqsh-e Rostam
summary: Royal necropolis with cliff-cut tombs and Sasanian investiture reliefs.
facts: Houses tombs of Darius I, Xerxes I, and others.

title: Sheikh Lotfollah Mosque
summary: Masterpiece mosque known for its turquoise dome and exquisite interior tilework.

title: Goharshad Mosque
summary: Commissioned by Queen Goharshad; renowned for its lofty iwan and calligraphy.
facts: Part of Imam Reza Shrine complex.

title: Dome of Soltaniyeh
summary: One of the world’s largest brick domes; engineering marvel of its time.
facts: Influenced later dome construction in the region.

title: Golestan Palace
summary: Royal complex blending Persian craft with European influences.

title: Azadi Tower
summary: Modern icon fusing Achaemenid and Islamic geometries.

title: Windcatchers of Yazd
summary: Passive cooling towers channeling desert breezes into interiors.
facts: Historic City of Yazd is UNESCO-listed.

title: Karim Khan Citadel
summary: Hybrid palace-fortress built by Karim Khan Zand.
facts: Leaning corner towers for defensive visibility.
Served as royal court, prison, and now museum.
